speaker: Alice
content: Bree Van De Kamp who lives next door, brought baskets of muffins she baked from scratch.
mark: next door 隔壁
basket 篮子
muffin 小松糕；英国松饼
bake from scratch 从头开始烘焙：指食品完全从基础原料开始制作，而不是使用预先制作好的混合物或面团。bake 烤，烘，焙；炎热，灼热；炙烤，受晒
scratch v./n. 挠，轻抓；划痕，划伤；from scratch 从零开始

speaker: Alice
content: Bree was known for her cooking.
mark: be known for 因……而众所周知

speaker: Alice
content: And for making her own clothes.

speaker: Alice
content: And for doing her own gardening.
mark: do gardening 做园艺

speaker: Alice
content: And for reupholstering her own furniture.
mark: reupholstering furniture 翻新家具 reupholster 重装椅面

speaker: Alice
content: Yes, Bree's many talents were known throughout the neighborhood.
mark: throughout prep./adv. 遍及，到处；自始至终，贯穿整个时期

speaker: Alice
content: And everyone on Wisteria Lane thought of Bree as the perfect wife and mother.
mark: think of sb as 把某人看作是……；认为某人是……

speaker: Alice
content: Everyone, that is, except her own family.
mark: that is 即；就是说；换言之

speaker: Paul
content: Bree, you shouldn't have gone to all this trouble.
mark: you shouldn’t have gone to all this trouble. 你本不该费这么大周折的
回答：It was no trouble at all. 这根本不麻烦
shouldn't have + 过去分词结构用于表示过去本不应该做某事，但实际上做了
go to trouble 做额外的工作：指做一些会给自己带来额外工作的事情。

speaker: Bree
content: It was no trouble at all.

speaker: Bree
content: Now, the basket with the red ribbon is filled with desserts for your guests.
mark: ribbon 丝带，绸带
be filled with 充满，装满,被……填满 == be full of

speaker: Bree
content: But the one with the blue ribbon is just for you and Zachary.

speaker: Bree
content: It's got rolls, muffins, breakfast type things.
mark: 's got = has got = has 拥有、具有
rolls 面包卷; 滚动（roll 的复数）；捆；
breakfast type things 早餐类的东西

speaker: Bree
content: Well, the least I could do is make sure you boys had a decent meal to look forward to in the morning.
mark: least 最低程度地；最少，至少 一点儿；最少的
the least I could do is... 我至少能做的是……；我最起码可以做的是……
The least I could do is (to) make sure (that) you boys had a decent meal.
1. make sure前省略了to，不定式短语作表语时，如果主语部分含有实义动词（这里是do），可省略 to。
2. 从句中用had，与前面的could在时态上保持一致，这种表达是站在过去的角度，讲述过去觉得自己至少能做的事是确保孩子们吃上像样的饭。也可改成 would have.
decent 像样的，尚好的；得体的，合宜的；
look forward to 期待：对未来某事的期待和兴奋。

speaker: Bree
content: I know you're out of your minds with grief.
mark: out of your minds with grief. 因为悲伤而失去理智

speaker: Bree
content: Of course, I will need the baskets back once you're done.
